headline: L3Harris Technologies (NYSE:LHX) Reports US$5.1 Billion Sales With Higher Earnings Growth
summary: L3Harris Technologies (NYSE:LHX) recently reported its Q1 2025 earnings, revealing a 2% decline in sales while net income improved to $386 million, showcasing enhanced profitability. This earnings release may have influenced its share price movement, with the stock's 2.66% gain over the past month aligning closely with broader market trends, where the market rose by 2.3%. Meanwhile, the company's expansion of its space manufacturing facility and a long-term agreement with the Dutch Ministry...

headline: L3Harris Beats on Q1 Earnings, Lowers '25 Revenue View
summary: LHX's Q1 revenues of $5.13 billion miss the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 1.9% and decline 1.5% year over year.

headline: L3Harris cuts 2025 forecasts on aviation business divestiture
summary: Shares of the company fell about 3% in premarket trading.  The Melbourne, Florida-based company said it expects an adjusted profit of between $10.30 and $10.50 per share in 2025, lower than its previous forecast of $10.55 to $10.85.  It completed the sale of its commercial aviation business, through which L3 provided flight training, analytics and avionics services, for $800 million to TJC in March.

headline: L3Harris (LHX) Surpasses Q1 Earnings Estimates
summary: L3Harris (LHX) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 3.88% and 1.89%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: L3Harris: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: LHX) on Thursday reported first-quarter net income of $386 million. On a per-share basis, the Melbourne, Florida-based company said it had profit of $2.04. Earnings, adjusted for asset impairment costs and non-recurring costs, were $2.41 per share.

headline: L3Harris Technologies Reports First Quarter 2025 Results, Updates 2025 Guidance
summary: MELBOURNE, Fla., April 24, 2025--L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) reported first quarter 2025 diluted EPS of $2.04 on first quarter 2025 revenue of $5.1 billion. First quarter 2025 non-GAAP diluted EPS was $2.41. Reconciliations of non-GAAP results are detailed in tables beginning on page 10.
